Under the energy savings plan, all EU member states will strive to reduce gas consumption by 15% from August through to the end of March. Energy ministers from the 27 member states, except Hungary, backed a voluntary 15% reduction in gas usage over the winter, a target that could become mandatory if the Kremlin ordered a complete shutdown of gas to Europe. q003.question: According to the article, how close was the no-confidence vote against Prime Minister Manmohan Singh, and what unusual step was taken to ensure voting could occur?
q003.answer: NEW DELHI, India (CNN) -- President George W. Bush called India's prime minister Thursday to push a proposed nuclear partnership that sparked an unsuccessful no-confidence vote against the Indian leader this week, a White House spokesman said. A no-confidence vote would have forced Singh to resign, and required the government to hold early elections unless a new coalition could have been formed. Prime Minister Manmohan Singh won a confidence vote despite opposition to the nuclear deal.

answers.answer: NEW DELHI, India (CNN) -- President George W. Bush called India's prime minister Thursday to push a proposed nuclear partnership that sparked an unsuccessful no-confidence vote against the Indian leader this week, a White House spokesman said. A no-confidence vote would have forced Singh to resign, and required the government to hold early elections unless a new coalition could have been formed. Prime Minister Manmohan Singh won a confidence vote despite opposition to the nuclear deal.
